attributes.action: instruct the administrators of the petition site to specify WHICH petition a rejected petition is similar to!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Since being alerted to this web-site I have created a lot of petitions; of those that are rejected most are because they are similar to one already created.  Before creating any petition I look right through all those on the relevant issue; having been informed that one of mine is similar I have to spend varying amounts of time, sometimes a very LONG time, looking through ALL the petitions on that issue to try to guess which is referred to; and then resubmit mine accordingly.  I realise there are over 7,000 petitions but if it is possible to identify the fact that a new one is similar to a previous one why isn't it possible to specify the petition that is similar?

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
